thread.title: Bradley Walsh backs The Chase contestant after she reaches final alone | Metro News
thread.title_full: Bradley Walsh backs The Chase contestant after she reaches final alone | Metro News

author: Hannah Lawrence For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Bradley Walsh backs The Chase contestant after she reaches final alone | Metro News
text:
Hannah Lawrence for Metro.co.uk Saturday 25 Feb 2017 3:03 pm Andrea made it to the final on her own with £100,000 in the bank (Picture: ITV) 
Fans got behind a contestant on The Chase after she made it to the final on her own with £100,000 in the bank. 
Charity's plan to seduce Frank badly backfires in Emmerdale? It was a tense final as Andrea, 60, from Cardiff, faced the Dark Destroyer, Shaun Wallace, for the show’s huge cash prize. 
In an ideal game of The Chase each contestant will put something into the team’s pot and they will take on the chaser together in the final but for Andrea things worked out a little differently. 
The contestant ended up facing Wallace alone with £100,000 in the bank after host Bradley Walsh sent her team members, Chris, PJ and Nat, home. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Things were looking good for Andrea though when she managed to get a 12 point lead over the chaser, with Walsh saying he thought it was a record lead. And fans began to get very emotionally invested in Andrea: Come on Andrea! #TheChase 
— Tom Brewer (@TomBrewer87) February 23, 2017 Absolutely rooting for Andrea here! #TheChase
